sam.gribbles wrote:

> I'm new to Junit testing and have been able to do some basic testing
> etc.
> What I want to do now is test for objects that are returned in random
> order. E.G. I have a few Fortune Cookies that are stored in an array of
> Strings. I've written some code that returns them randomly.
> What is the best method for testing? i.e. should I be using Mocks?
> If anybody has any good examples or relevant web sites please let me
> know.
> 
> Your help is greatly appreciated.

I see this as similar to the "how do I test console output?" question. 
The answer there is to depend on an abstract stream, then plug in the 
console stream in production. I think of randomness as generating a 
stream of numbers, so depend on "a stream of numbers" rather than a 
"random number generator". Then, in production, use a "random number 
generator" implementation of the "stream of numbers". It'll just work.
